    • onBlockActivated

      @NotNull public @NotNull net.minecraft.util.ActionResultType onBlockActivated(@NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.block.BlockState state, net.minecraft.world.World worldIn, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerEntity player, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.util.Hand handIn, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.util.math.BlockRayTraceResult hit)
      Called when player interacts with a block. Opens UI.
      Overrides:
      onBlockActivated in class net.minecraft.block.AbstractBlock
      Parameters:
      state - block state of interacted block.
      worldIn - world of interacted block.
      pos - position of interacted block.
      player - player which interacted with the block.
      handIn - hand of the player.
      hit - ray trace result.
      Returns:
      success if no exception was thrown.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if block's tile entity isn't instance of CauldronEntity.

    • pickupFluid

      @NotNull public @NotNull net.minecraft.fluid.Fluid pickupFluid(net.minecraft.world.IWorld worldIn, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.block.BlockState state)
      Picks up one bucket of fluid from the block. If block doesn't contain any fluid returns empty. If block contains less than one bucket returns empty. If the block doesn't implement IMyLiquidTankTile returns false.
      Specified by:
      pickupFluid in interface net.minecraft.block.IBucketPickupHandler
      Returns:
      picked up fluid. Can be empty.

    • canContainFluid

      public boolean canContainFluid(net.minecraft.world.IBlockReader worldIn, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.block.BlockState state, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.fluid.Fluid fluidIn)
      Returns true if block can contained provided fluid. If tile entity of this block doesn't implement IMyLiquidTankTile always returns false.
      Specified by:
      canContainFluid in interface net.minecraft.block.ILiquidContainer
      Returns:
      true if block can contained provided fluid.

    • receiveFluid

      public boolean receiveFluid(net.minecraft.world.IWorld worldIn, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.block.BlockState state, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.fluid.FluidState fluidStateIn)
      Adds 1 bucket of fluid into tile entity and returns true. If fluid is not source, no fluid will be recieved and returns false; If tile entity doesn't implement IMyLiquidTankTile block cannot store fluids and returns false.
      Specified by:
      receiveFluid in interface net.minecraft.block.ILiquidContainer
      Returns:
      true if successfully stored fluid, otherwise false.
